name: Omer Ben-Porat
content: Omer Ben-Porat (Personal)Search this siteEmbedded FilesSkip to main contentSkip to navigationOmer Ben-Porat (עומר בן-פורת)I'm an assistant professor, mentor, advisor, and a bunch of other stuff. Click here for my academic webpage.Also, here is my LinkedIn account and a link to drop anonymous feedback.Nine Facts About Me:- I am happily married to Gili, and we have three sons – Bar, Raz, and Gal.- I have visited 28 different countries and hope to visit 10 more in the next decade.- At certain points in my life, I was fluent in four languages. - I love sports–especially running and hiking, reading books (both nonfiction and fiction), and building LEGO with my kids.- I grew up near Tel Aviv but fell in love with Haifa, where I currently live.- As a faculty member at Technion, I conduct research with graduate students and colleagues, apply for grants, review academic work, teach, and mentor the next generation of researchers and engineers. - I am actively involved in industry across several fields. In the past, I worked at Intel, Yahoo!, and Google, and I have served as an expert consultant for Matrix, AppsFlyer, and Lightblocks. - I relate to Abraham Lincoln's quote: 'Give me six hours to chop down a tree, and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.' I believe in thoughtful preparation—breaking down big ideas into clear, actionable steps. - I am always looking for interesting opportunities with extraordinary people.Google SitesReport abuseGoogle SitesReport abuse
